00013 #define HTTP_MESSAGE_FLAG_CONNECTION_CLOSE   1
00014 #define HTTP_MESSAGE_FLAG_TRANSFER_CHUNKED   2
00015 #define HTTP_MESSAGE_FLAG_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH 4
00016 #define HTTP_MESSAGE_FLAG_KEEPALIVE          8

00031 typedef struct tagHTTP_MESSAGE {
00032   
00033   int flags;
00034   int content_length;
00035   DLISTUNR header_values;
00036 } HTTP_MESSAGE;
00037 
00038 int  HTTP_MESSAGE_init( HTTP_MESSAGE *message );
00039 
00040 void HTTP_MESSAGE_free( HTTP_MESSAGE *message );
00041 
00042 int HTTP_MESSAGE_add_header( HTTP_MESSAGE *message, const char *name , const char *value );
00043 
00044 M_INLINE void HTTP_MESSAGE_set_content_length( HTTP_MESSAGE *message, int content_length )
00045 {
00046   message->flags |= HTTP_MESSAGE_FLAG_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH;
00047   message->content_length = content_length;
00048 }
00049

00094 /**
00095  * @brief HTTP_REQUEST - holds information of an http request.
00096  *
00097  * @{
00098  */
00099 typedef struct tagHTTP_REQUEST {
00100   HTTP_MESSAGE base;
00101   
00102   // request line
00103   Http_method_type method;
00104   URI url; 
00105   char *raw_url;
00106   Http_version_type version; 
00107 
00108   // does the request expect 100 continue response?
00109   int expect_100_continue;
00110 
00111   // host headera
00112   int has_host_header;
00113   char *host_header;
00114   int host_header_port;
00115 
00116 } HTTP_REQUEST;
00117 
00118 int HTTP_REQUEST_is_persistent( HTTP_REQUEST *message );
00119 
00120 M_INLINE int HTTP_REQUEST_init( HTTP_REQUEST *message )
00121 {
00122   if (HTTP_MESSAGE_init( &message->base )) {
00123     return -1;
00124   }
00125 
00126   URI_init( & message->url );
00127 
00128   message->expect_100_continue = message->has_host_header = 0;
00129   message->raw_url = message->host_header = 0;
00130   message->has_host_header = 0;
00131   message->host_header_port = -1;
00132 
00133   return 0;
00134 }
00135 
00136 M_INLINE void HTTP_REQUEST_free( HTTP_REQUEST *message )
00137 {
00138   URI_free( &message->url );
00139   
00140   if (message->host_header) {
00141     free( message->host_header);
00142   }
00143   if (message->raw_url) {
00144     free( message->raw_url );
00145   }
00146 
00147   message->expect_100_continue = message->has_host_header = 0;
00148   message->raw_url = message->host_header = 0;
00149   message->has_host_header = 0;
00150   message->host_header_port = -1;
00151 
00152   HTTP_MESSAGE_free( &message->base );
00153 }
00154  
00155 /**
00156  * @}
00157  */

00161 typedef int  (*HTTP_REQ_HEADER_PARSED)     (HTTP_REQUEST *request, void *ctx);
00162 typedef int  (*HTTP_REQ_MESSAGE_BODY_DATA) (HTTP_REQUEST *request, void *data, size_t data_size, void *ctx);
00163 typedef int  (*HTTP_REQ_FINISHED)          (HTTP_REQUEST *request, void *ctx);

00169 /**
00170  * @brief HTTP_REQUEST - holds information of an http response.
00171  *
00172  * @{
00173  */
00174 typedef struct tagHTTP_RESPONSE {
00175   HTTP_MESSAGE base;
00176  
00177   int status_code;
00178   Http_version_type version; 
00179 
00180 
00181 } HTTP_RESPONSE;
00182 
00183 M_INLINE int HTTP_RESPONSE_init( HTTP_RESPONSE *message, Http_version_type version, int status_code )
00184 {
00185   if (HTTP_MESSAGE_init( &message->base ) ) {
00186     return -1;
00187   }
00188   message->status_code = status_code;
00189   message->version = version;
00190   return 0;
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00194 M_INLINE void HTTP_RESPONSE_free( HTTP_RESPONSE *message )
00195 {
00196   HTTP_MESSAGE_free( &message->base );
00197 }

00225 /** 
00226  * @brief base class of both http request and http response parsers
00227  *
00228  * @{
00229  */
00230 typedef struct tagHTTP_PARSER {
00231   HTTP_STATE_PARSING  state;
00232   HASH header_action;  
00233   char *token;  // the current parsed header token.
00234   size_t token_length; // length of token buffer
00235 
00236   char *tokpos; // current position in http header data - during parsing of header.
00237  
00238   size_t  content_left; // how many bytes will make up the following chunk or Content-length data.
00239 
00240 } HTTP_PARSER;
00241 
00242 typedef enum {
00243   PARSER_STATUS_ERROR = -1,
00244   PARSER_STATUS_COMPLETED = 0,
00245   PARSER_STATUS_NEED_MORE_DATA = 1,
00246 }
00247   PARSER_STATUS;

00252   HTTP_TK_SEPARATOR,
00253   HTTP_TK_EOF,

00280  * @return -1 error, 0 - http header finished, 1 - need more data, 2 - header line parsed ok.
00281  */

00417 typedef struct tagHTTP_RESPONSE_WRITER
00418 {
00419    HTTP_RESPONSE *response;
00420    HTTP_RESPONSE_WR_STATE state; 
00421    DLISTUNR_position header_position;
00422    int state_header;
00423 
00424 }  HTTP_RESPONSE_WRITER;
00425 
00426 
00427 M_INLINE void HTTP_RESPONSE_WRITER_init( HTTP_RESPONSE_WRITER *writer, HTTP_RESPONSE *response)
00428 {
00429   writer->response = response;
00430   writer->state = HTTP_RESPONSE_WR_STATUS_LINE;
00431 }
